courseWork.title: Journal Prompt - T.V.
courseWork.description:
How much t.v. do you watch on a daily basis? 
What devices do you watch t.v. on? For example, a television, a laptop, an ipod, a cell phone, etc.
What are some of the shows you like to watch? 
Do you prefer watching episodes of your favorite shows, movies, cartoons, series, youtube, etc?
Why do you watch these? To learn? For entertainment? Because your friends watch them?
What would you do if your parents said you could not watch any t.v.?How would you feel? How would you spend your time?
What else? Write about anything else that this prompt makes you think of.
Try to type about a page.

Why do you watch these? To learn? For entertainment? Because your friends watch them?
What would you do if your parents said you could not watch any t.v.?How would you feel? How would you spend your time?
What else? Write about anything else that this prompt makes you think of.
Try to type about a page.

courseWork.title:
Commas - Grammar Bot
Using commas in sentences
courseWork.description:
Write 5 different sentences so you can practice using commas.

One will be a sentence with an introduction. 
Four will be 4 compound sentences using and, or, but, and so.

Create a google doc.
Capitalization and punctuation count. 
Each sentence will be worth 3 points, 1 point for beginning with a capital letter, 1 point for using a comma correctly and 1 point for end punctuation. 

See my example.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Write 5 different sentences so you can practice using commas.

One will be a sentence with an introduction.
Four will be 4 compound sentences using and, or, but, and so.

Create a google doc.
Capitalization and punctuation count.
Each sentence will be worth 3 points, 1 point for beginning with a capital letter, 1 point for using a comma correctly and 1 point for end punctuation.

See my example.

driveFile.title: Loz McKenzie - Commas - Grammar Bot Using commas in sentences

comments.comment:
You did really good on these, Loz. Remember when we talked about the last sentence?

The second part needs to be a sentence that can stand alone. 

Here's an example:

I really wish I could own an xbox, or I'd take a ps5.

See how the second part could be it's own sentence? 

Like this:
I'd take a ps5.

That's what makes a compound sentence - two sentences joined with a comma and a conjunction.
comments.commentHtml:
You did really good on these, Loz. Remember when we talked about the last sentence?

The second part needs to be a sentence that can stand alone.

Here's an example:

I really wish I could own an xbox, or I'd take a ps5.

See how the second part could be it's own sentence?

Like this:
I'd take a ps5.

That's what makes a compound sentence - two sentences joined with a comma and a conjunction.

shortAnswerSubmission.answer: I like you said One thing I’m extremely grateful for is my health. You take good care of yourself by eating healthy, exercising and getting plenty of rest. Your body is strong, healthy and capable. You love to hike, bike, swim, ski and do yoga. You try to look on the sunny side of things and maintain a positive outlook.  That was what I liked about your writing.

courseWork.title: Journal Prompt - Freedom
courseWork.description:
What does freedom mean to you? What does a free person look like? What do they do? 
How do they act? 

In the book, The Little House on the Prairie, Pa told Laura that freedom is being able “to take care of ourselves”. Do you agree with this statement?

Take a moment to think about all the freedoms you enjoy in your daily life. What are they? Describe them.

What freedoms do you not have, but wish you did?

Do you think you have more or less freedom than other people in the world?

Lastly, is freedom free?
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
What does freedom mean to you? What does a free person look like? What do they do?
How do they act?

In the book, The Little House on the Prairie, Pa told Laura that freedom is being able “to take care of ourselves”. Do you agree with this statement?

Take a moment to think about all the freedoms you enjoy in your daily life. What are they? Describe them.

What freedoms do you not have, but wish you did?

Do you think you have more or less freedom than other people in the world?

Lastly, is freedom free?

comments.comment: Kids have not been doing a good job of reading and following directions in grammar. We talked about not redoing these last time when most kids did poorly on the Titles lesson because they did not refer back to the information that would help them get the work done correctly. Kids aren't allowed to redo this assignment because I'm really trying to get students to take responsibility for their work the first time they do it. Kids need to read and follow directions, slow down, and check their work. I also showed all the answers for you so that you would know why you got them wrong.
comments.commentHtml: Kids have not been doing a good job of reading and following directions in grammar. We talked about not redoing these last time when most kids did poorly on the Titles lesson because they did not refer back to the information that would help them get the work done correctly. Kids aren't allowed to redo this assignment because I'm really trying to get students to take responsibility for their work the first time they do it. Kids need to read and follow directions, slow down, and check their work. I also showed all the answers for you so that you would know why you got them wrong.

courseWork.title: Journal Prompt - A Day All To Myself
courseWork.description:
A Day All To Myself

If you had a day all to yourself and could do whatever you wanted to, what would you do?
Start with waking up and describe the entire day. Include things like what you’d eat, who you’d 
see, where you’d go and what you’d do. You can do anything you want. There are no limits.

Try to stretch your writing by including descriptions of the senses. 
What do you see, smell, hear, taste and feel? Try to paint a picture in your reader’s mind.

Create a google doc. Use a fun font, that is easy to read and a size 12 font.
Try to write about a page.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
A Day All To Myself

If you had a day all to yourself and could do whatever you wanted to, what would you do?
Start with waking up and describe the entire day. Include things like what you’d eat, who you’d
see, where you’d go and what you’d do. You can do anything you want. There are no limits.

Try to stretch your writing by including descriptions of the senses.
What do you see, smell, hear, taste and feel? Try to paint a picture in your reader’s mind.

Create a google doc. Use a fun font, that is easy to read and a size 12 font.
Try to write about a page.

comments.comment: Loz, you need to add several paragraphs. Indent when there is a new idea or a new setting.
comments.commentHtml: Loz, you need to add several paragraphs. Indent when there is a new idea or a new setting.

comments.comment:
Adding paragraphs made this easier to read.

You really need to listen in class. A personal narrative is a true story about something that happened to you in your life. 

This isn't about you.

courseWork.title: Grammar Lesson 2
courseWork.description: Upload page 189 of your grammar workbook here.
courseWork.descriptionHtml: Upload page 189 of your grammar workbook here.

driveFile.title: Underline the complete subject in each sentence once. Underline the.pdf

comments.comment:
Loz, you'll need to redo this. The simple subject and simple predicates are only one word.

#1 underline alarm once, it's the simple subject and underline rang twice, it's the simple predicate.

Ask yourself who did what, or what did what?

Answer: alarm rang
comments.commentHtml:

Answer: alarm rang

courseWork.title: Spelling Sentences - U2 History Terms
courseWork.description:
Write a sentence for each spelling word on the U2 History Terms list.

*Each sentence needs to be 7 words long, or longer.* 

Remember to start each sentence with a capital letter and use end punctuation.
Create a google doc for this assignment.

courseWork.title: Stretch It
courseWork.description:
Make it each sentence longer by adding details, descriptions, color, action or senses. 
Do not use pronouns. Ex. he, she, we, them, I, her it, etc.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Make it each sentence longer by adding details, descriptions, color, action or senses.
Do not use pronouns. Ex. he, she, we, them, I, her it, etc.

topics.name: Journal Prompt - If your pet could talk . . .

courseWork.title: Journal Prompt - If your pet could talk . . .
courseWork.description:
Write a story about what your pet would say if he or she could talk. 
Tell about an entire day, or longer, from your pet's perspective.

What would they want? Would they give away your secrets?
Would they be demanding? Grateful? Adventurous? 

If you don't have a pet, pretend that you do. Choose any animal as your pet.

Create a google doc and write at least a page.
courseWork.descriptionHtml:
Write a story about what your pet would say if he or she could talk.
Tell about an entire day, or longer, from your pet's perspective.

What would they want? Would they give away your secrets?
Would they be demanding? Grateful? Adventurous?

If you don't have a pet, pretend that you do. Choose any animal as your pet.

Create a google doc and write at least a page.

courseWork.title: Journal Prompt - Self Perception
courseWork.description:
Create a doc. You may have to stretch yourself for this one. Read the prompt several times if needed. There's no wrong way to do this. You're really just writing about yourself. 
Have fun and be honest.

comments.comment: Loz, you have some original information in your letter that helps me get to know you better. However, a lot of what you wrote sounds just like my letter to the class. Can you take those parts out and replace them? If you need some ideas about what to write about tell me what kind of foods you like, who your friends are, if you have pets, etc.
